channel.title: The Ark
channel.description: The Ark is the weekly newspaper of Tiburon, Belvedere and Strawberry

item.title: Tiburon hires consultant to prepare for rising sea levels
item.description: Tiburon will spend nearly $600,000 in state grant money to hire a consultant to plan how the town will address rising sea levels threatening its shorelines.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Tiburon officer charged with DUI, child cruelty, pleads not guilty
item.description: Tiburon police officer William Forrest Condit has pleaded not guilty to one count of misdemeanor child cruelty and two counts of misdemeanor drunken driving.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister

item.title: Everyday Encounters: An aspiring actor encourages others to follow their dreams
item.description: The 31-year-old Tiburon resident from Tijuana, Mexico, is recently secured her first paid gig in Los Angeles.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Mahjong’s moment: Local classes draw all ages as tactile, social game sees surge in popularity
item.description: Throughout the Tiburon Peninsula — offered by the Belvedere-Tiburon Library, Strawberry Recreation District and The Ranch — mahjong classes are exploding in popularity.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister

item.title: Tiburon Peninsula artists open studios for annual ICB showcase
item.description: Tiburon Peninsula artists will open their studios to the public Nov. 15-16 as part of the 57th annual ICB Art Open Studios in Sausalito.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister

item.title: Strawberry senior-housing project enters 60-day fast-track review
item.description: Marin County planners deemed complete the application for a 106-unit senior-living facility on Strawberry’s North Knoll Road on Nov. 6.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister
